course_title: Piety and Politics: Evangelicalism in America
course_description: What is the evangelical tradition? What are the social, cultural & political contexts out of which evangelicalism emerged and evolved? What does evangelical signify in America & the world today? Students in this course will address these questions as they study the evangelical tradition in America from 18th century to present. Students study the evangelical tradition as a historical & multiracial phenomenon, in relation to American culture & politics, & within transnational & global contexts.
